Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by Swami Yuktatmananda, Ramakrishna-Vivekananda Center of New York, located at 17 East 94th Street, New York, NY 10128.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Krishnan.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Swami Yuktatmananda, Ramakrishna-Vivekananda Center of New York, located at 17 East 94th Street, New York, N.Y. 10128.

Council Member Krishnan moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of October 5, 2023 and October 19, 2023 be adopted as printed by Council Member Joseph.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Joseph moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of October 5, 2023 and October 19, 2023 be adopted as printed.

Reports of Standing Committees
Resolution calling on the Governor to sign S.4266A/A.5088A, which establishes a task force on missing women and girls who are Black, Indigenous and people of color.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Establishes a task force on missing women and girls who are Black, Indigenous and people of color.  (S.4266A/A.5088A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing penalties, allowing opportunities to cure for certain violations, and eliminating certain requirements for commercial establishments; to repeal subchapters 6, 9, 12, and 15 of chapter 5 of title 20 of such code, relating to availability for sale of advertised merchandise, sale of travel tickets, delayed payment transactions billing practices, and disclosure of information by child care facilities, respectively; to repeal the row that begins 24-237(c) in table I in paragraph 5 of subdivision (b) of section 24-257 of such code, relating to penalties for operation of a steam whistle; and to make other technical changes in relation thereto
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Reducing penalties, allowing opportunities to cure for certain violations, and eliminating certain requirements for commercial establishments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.5256/A.7196, to prohibit the use of a confession of judgment in business loans.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Small Business
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Prohibit the use of a confession of judgment in business loans. (S.5256/A.7196)

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers).

There were 51 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.
The Majority Leader (Council Member Powers) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 569-B,  VOTE: 43-8-0 
Negative: CMs Ariola, Carr, Holden, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

Int. No. 687-A,  VOTE: 44-7-0
Negative: CMs Ariola, Carr, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

Int. No. 1208,  VOTE: 43-8-0
Negative: CMs Ariola, Carr, Holden, Kagan, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

L.U. No. 275 & Res. No. 842, 
L.U. No. 276 & Res. No. 843
VOTE: 50-1-0
Negative: CM Barron.

See files for individual votes.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Wednesday, November 15, 2023.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
